description: This file defines the authentication provider for a Flutter application, managing login, registration, and logout states using Riverpod. It includes classes for representing auth states and a notifier for handling auth logic such as API calls, token storage, and state updates.

classes.name: AuthState
classes.description: Immutable class representing the current authentication state, including token, loading status, error messages, and authentication status.

classes.name: AuthNotifier
classes.description: A StateNotifier that manages the authentication state, handling login, registration, token persistence, and logout.

methods.name: AuthState.initial
methods.description: Factory constructor that returns the initial authentication state with no token and not authenticated.

methods.name: AuthState.copyWith
methods.description: Creates a copy of the AuthState with optional new values for its properties.

methods.name: AuthNotifier._loadToken
methods.description: Loads the token from local storage and updates the authentication state accordingly.

methods.name: AuthNotifier.login
methods.description: Performs login by sending credentials to the backend API, storing the received token, and updating the auth state.

methods.name: AuthNotifier.register
methods.description: Registers a new user via the backend API and attempts to log in upon success.

methods.name: AuthNotifier.logout
methods.description: Logs out the user by clearing the stored token and resetting the auth state.
